lines.text: How many did I kill?
Seven.
But there were only four of the ruffians.
You killed three of them twice.
Where are the bodies?
We threw them out the window.

[upon seeing Dr. Daka]
A Jap!
You will please to use the term 'Nipponese'.
lines.character: Dr. Tito Daka aka Prince Daka

lines.text: [upon seeing Dr. Daka]
A Jap!
Maybe you should go back to the hospital and wait for your uncle to call.
I'd like to find out what's going on.
I'd like to find out how he did that disappearing act. I'd like to try that when the creditors come after me.

[on the phone]
Get me Scotland Yard... I mean get me the police... get me anybody, I'm being murdered!
If you cooperate with us, you will share in the glorious victories soon to be ours.
lines.character: Dr. Tito Daka aka Prince Daka

lines.text: And if I refuse?
You have no choice but to accept. You will work with us or be compelled to work for us. Therefore it should be very plain to you that you should be willing to help serve my glorious emporer.
lines.character: Dr. Tito Daka aka Prince Daka

lines.text: Listen, Daka, or whatever your name is, I owe my allegience to no country or order but my own. I am an American first and always, and no amount of torture conceived by your twisted Oriental brain will make me change my mind.

[pointing out his derringer]
That's my little black widow. It's only got two bites, but both of them are fatal.

[referring to Linda]
You're liable to carry that masquerade too far.
Think so?
Yes, I do. Why don't you let her know who you really are instead of letting her think you're just a good-for-nothing playboy?

Well, if she knew I was the Batman, she might worry - not that she cares anything about me. Besides, on account of special assignment from Uncle Sam, our success depends on keeping our ability to keep our identity a secret.
And suppose she asks about your status in the army?
Oh, I'm only still a 4-F.

[seeing Prince Daka]
Oh, a Jap!

[as Batman struggles against two zombies]
It is useless to struggle. My zombies are too strong, even for a superior person like yourself to cope with.
lines.character: Dr. Tito Daka aka Prince Daka

lines.text: The League of the New Order of Hirohito, Heavenly Ruler and Prince of the Rising Sun, marches on, and nothing will ever stop it. You might just as well try to stop the tides, the winds.
lines.character: Dr. Tito Daka aka Prince Daka

lines.text: This was part of a foreign land, transplanted bodily to America and known as Little Tokyo. Since a wise government rounded up the immoral hoods, it has become virtually a ghost street, where only one business survives, eking out a precarious existence on the dimes of curiosity-seekers.
You think we can catch them?
Sure, I just hope we catch them before a speed cop catches us.

[holding a gun on Daka]
Now, are you going to open that door and let me out or would you like a quick visit to your ancestors?
But of course, Foster.
lines.character: Dr. Tito Daka aka Prince Daka

lines.text:
[with contempt]
That's the kind of answer that fits the color of your skin.

[after feeding his pet crocodiles]
That's just an appetizer. The main course will be served when Bruce Wayne gets here.
lines.character: Dr. Tito Daka aka Prince Daka

lines.text: With these bells we better get out of here. We don't want the police to catch us in these outfits.
[first lines]

High atop one of the hills which ring the teaming metropolis of Gotham City, a large house rears its bulk against the dark sky. Outwardly there's nothing to distinguish this house from many others, but deep in the cavernous basements of this house is a chamber hewn from the living rock of the mountainside, strange, dimly lighted, mysteriously secret bat cave headquarters of America's #1 crimefighter, Batman! Yes, Batman, clad in the somber costume which has struck terror to the heart of many swaggering denizens of the Underworld. Batman, who is even now pondering a plan of a new assault against the forces of crime, a crushing blow against evil, in which he will have the valuable aid of his young, two-fisted assistant, Robin, the Boy Wonder. They represent American youth who love their country and are glad to fight for it, whereever crime raises its ugly head to strike with the venom of a maddened rattlesnake. Batman and Robin strike also, and in this very hour when the Axis criminals are spreading their evil over the world, even in our own land, Batman and Robin stand ready to fight them to the death.
